# ButtonToggle

<MessageBar noActions intent="inform">
  <Code>ButtonToggle</Code> does not support uncontrolled versions.
</MessageBar>

`ButtonToggle` behaves as radio button group. Use this when the user may select only one of a small set of options.
Control externally via `value` and `onChange` props. On individual `ButtonItem`, `value` is optional and will fall back to the text if absent.

<Editor code={storyBasic} />

## Disabled

Use a disabled Button Toggle to indicate to the user what action will be possible on a page once a prerequisite action is taken. Disabled buttons do not respond to user interaction.

<Editor code={storyDisabled} />

## Nullable

Use the `nullable` prop if the user should be able to click the selected item to de-select it.

<Editor code={storyNullable} />

## Options

An alternative to composing a `ButtonGroup` or `ButtonToggle` with `ButtonItem` children is to pass it an array of `options`.

<Editor code={storyNullable} />

## Props

<ArgsTable of={ButtonToggle} exclude={excludedProps} />
